medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient noted a small, white lump on the posterior upper right arm approximately 18 months prior, which resembled a wart. It later became reddish, and a surface scab developed. After an excisional biopsy 16 months ago, it was diagnosed as a traumatized Spitz nevus. Small, raised red lesions in a starburst pattern appeared near the scar 2 to 3 months post-excision, growing to approximately 2.5 cm in diameter over the course of a year. An excision one month before the current evaluation led to a diagnosis of severely atypical, recurrent, multifocal, epithelioid-cell melanocytic proliferation consistent with melanoma.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Attention deficit disorder, treated with amphetamine and dextroamphetamine.
medical_history.social_history: Lives with parents and a sibling; a student; does not smoke or drink alcohol.
